alert.note: Alert for Central Chelan County; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 2:16PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Douglas and south central Chelan Counties through 245 PM PDT... At 216 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near West Wenatchee, or 7 miles west of Wenatchee, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wenatchee, East Wenatchee, Cashmere, Rock Island, Sunnyslope, East Wenatchee Bench, South Wenatchee, West Wenatchee, Scotty Creek Campground, Monitor, Stump Campground, and Malaga. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 111 and 133. U.S. Highway 97 in Washington between mile markers 165 and 176, and between mile markers 180 and 181. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Chelan County; Waterville Plateau; Wenatchee Area
